@JonathanRHeaps @Von_Balthasar Ok, thatâ€™s similar to my push back against Marxist â€˜totalityâ€™ in Lefebvre & my acceptance of poststructuralist â€˜movementâ€™...

@JonathanRHeaps Ah, yes. My Lefebvrean side would want to argue against â€˜wholenessâ€™, but I grant thatâ€™s a better notion of narrative then I had expected. I just have a foot (intended) in anthropologies of motion. Perception & motion are intertwined in the formation of meanings...

@JonathanRHeaps In what sense? I take narrative to be linear, while human action is non-linear. Thereâ€™s a bit of â€˜politics of choiceâ€™... What do we choose to narrate in human action? I find what isnâ€™t narrated to be compelling.
Thatâ€™s a bit scatter gun...
